title: Homemade Ketchup
full_text:
Homemade Ketchup
Close
Jump to recipe
Cook
75 mins
Active
60 mins
Total
75 mins
Serves
32 servings
Cook Mode
(Keep screen awake)
Ingredients
2
tablespoons
olive oil
1
medium
onion
, chopped medium
1
clove
garlic
, minced
1
(
28-ounce) can
tomato purée
1/2
cup
packed dark brown sugar
1/4
cup
cider vinegar
1
tablespoon
tomato paste
1/2
teaspoon
kosher salt
1/2
teaspoon
ground mustard
1/8
teaspoon
ground cloves
1/8
teaspoon
allspice
1/8
teaspoon
cayenne pepper
Directions
Heat oil in a medium saucepan over medium heat until shimmering. Add in the onion and cook, stirring occasionally, until softened but not browned, 5 to 8 minutes. Add in the garlic and stir until fragrant, about 30 seconds. Add the tomato purée, brown sugar, vinegar, tomato paste, salt, mustard, cloves, allspice, and cayenne pepper and stir to combine. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat to low and simmer, stirring occasionally, until thickened to the consistency of ketchup, 45 to 60 minutes.
Serious Eats / Qi Ai
Place ketchup in the jar of a blender and purée until completely smooth.
Serious Eats / Qi Ai
Wash and dry saucepan, then place a fine mesh strainer over top. Pour ketchup in the strainer and, using a spatula, force through all of the ketchup.
Serious Eats / Qi Ai
Taste ketchup and adjust seasonings if necessary. Pour ketchup into a jar, seal, and store in the refrigerator.
Serious Eats / Qi Ai
Special Equipment
Medium saucepan
,
blender
,
fine-mesh strainer
Make-Ahead and Storage
Store in the refrigerator for 3 weeks, or up to one month.
